website_summaries.verdict: A variety of programming and media options give you a gym-style experience at home.
pros: Features 29 total programs: 12 profile, 9 heart rate control, 4 custom, 2 fitness test, 1 quick start
In-console speakers with MP3 input, USB charging and fan
Perimeter-weighted flywheel allows easy start-up and smooth pedaling
cons: Some report computer system glitches that stop workouts mid-cycle

website_summaries.verdict: An ideal choice if you’re looking for a WiFi-enabled upright model that lets you track your progress.
pros: Easy to move to a new spot, thanks to front-side roller wheels and its adjustable seat and handlebars
Console can be personalized and some custom programming can be done
Compatible with the Schwinn Trainer and other fitness apps, to help track your progress
cons: Programming interface has a steep learning curve
It may shift around on smooth floors, so consider purchasing a mat
Not very quiet, and inertia wheel isn’t as smooth as pricier models

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, quiet, and I actually USE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Well, for the cost equivalent to a gym membership (which I historically, consistantly DO NOT go to) I now have a great machine at home, which I am using twice a day... yay!! Well worth the investment. This included free home installation, which only took 45 mins from opening the box, set up, to carting away the packaging. It is extremely quiet, I don’t have any problem with watching tv on my tablet, and there is a USB port to use. I’m 6’ tall, 250 lbs, and 68 yrs old.. the bike feels sturdy, solid and safe to use.
customer_reviews.author: mac kat

customer_reviews.title: and was easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: The bike shipped well, and was easy to put together. The pedals are affixed to the bike by a screw in mechanism that apparently loosens itself up when you ride. I managed to get about 4 rides in before both pedals had worked their way free enough to strip the inside of the housing badly enough that the pedals will now not attach to the bike. A bike without pedals just takes up space. I would not recommend this product as this seems to be a design issue.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Elwell

customer_reviews.title: Move Over Peloton!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike because when I had to go for physical therapy after my knee replacement, they had two Schwinns. I love this bike! Everything is digital and easy to understand and operate. The LCD display is large and you can read it easily. I don't use the bluetooth or the free training apps because for me there are plenty of built in programs and levels of resistance. I've had less expensive stationary bikes where the pedals eventually fell off. This bike is built solid and will probably outlive me! Compare this bike's features to the Peloton which requires you to manually turn a knob to adjust resistance!
customer_reviews.author: Carolee888

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good bike for the price. Wait for a sale on it if you can; $50 off is not uncommon. The assembly instructions were adequate for a handy-lady to assemble. My trainer uses this bike in his gym so it is used a lot. Be sure to put a mat under it to cushion your floors. A yoga mat worked fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sura

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike I have read some reviews of people who didn't but for my needs its great. For the price you can't ask for more. A couple things.. the speakers aren't great but I don't use them anyway. Second the seat is horribly uncomfortable and I couldn't stay on to long. Simple fix we got a seat cover off amazon for about 15$ and it's fine. I use this everyday and I like the challenges and fun rides. This thing isn't terribly heavy probably about 50 lbs. Be mindful that it does arrive 100% disassembled. In this price point you can't beat it. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Starr Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike. It was easy to put together, although it was helpful to have an additional person when connecting the wiring--Just easier to have someone hold the console mast when connecting. The seat is comfortable and the pedals fit well. It is extremely quiet. I am not familiar with everything on the console yet, but seems very easy to operate. I would recommend this product without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita Oser

customer_reviews.title: RideSocial app is fun!
customer_reviews.text: For those trying to figure out how to use the RideSocial app for this bike here is how: Download which ride (s) you want. I think you also need the schwinn app downloaded sorry but not certain about that. But i am certain about the following: - check that Bluetooth is on on the 170 itself (you may have to pedal a few turns to get it active) - open the RideSocial app and then Settings, Connect devices - Choose BLE devices, then scan, when you see the 170m listed, tap to connect. -After that press Quickstart & it will start.
customer_reviews.author: JoyceK

customer_reviews.title: Great stationary bike
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this stationary bike more stars, I would. I have been using it with my elliptical machine almost every day. Easy to use, my husband put it together very easily and the seat is very comfortable. Am so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Crooked
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered yesterday. It was easy to assemble, took maybe 45 minutes. Once assembled I realized the mast (the part the handlebars and computer are on) is crooked - it’s sort of rotated clockwise a bit. This makes using it awkward. There’s no way to fix it because all the holes are pre-drilled. I’m going to call Schwinn’s customer support today to see about getting replacement parts. If that doesn’t work out, I’ll have to box it up and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: The Duke

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and smooth.  Plenty of resistance to kick your butt.
customer_reviews.text: PRO - Quiet operation. Several decent programs to change it up. App is good. Support is great. I had it show up damaged and they sent replacement parts with zero hassle. Bravo! CON - Display is super bright and not adjustable. Volume of notifications is very loud and not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Pauses after just a minute of riding
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike in October of 2018. I have ridden it 15 hours so far. Now it automatically pauses after just a minute of riding. It think I've stopped pedaling. After researching online, I suspect it has something to do with the speed sensor. I'll need to pull the cranks and take off the shroud to investigate. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaPepper

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn quality is not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: The frame is bent and the console arrived with a stripped screw tightened to a herculean extent. Will contact customer service when they open Monday. This is the second schwinn bike I've bought that has arrived with issues. The first arrived with the cable that measures your heart rate cut but the bike still functioned as a bike. I'm really starting to question the schwinn name when it comes to quality. The styrofoam packaging also arrived cracked and broken in a way that would make it hard to repack once taken out, that's why I didn't replace the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Edwards

customer_reviews.title: A good bike, a good price
customer_reviews.text: Extremely quiet...like cant hear it at all quiet. Original seat is a sit bone killer so I bought a new seat here on Amazon called Serfas Exerciser EX - RXL. The new seat made a huge difference. Someone wrote about it in a blog online. Called to register my bike for warranty and the customer service girl named Wynter was excellent and very helpful. When putting the bike together I suggest a watching a video on YouTube called "Unboxing Schwinn 170 Upright Bike and Assembly" by kc70. Gave me a better understanding of what not to do especially when it came to the delicate wires. I really like the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Miss April

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and smooth. I have used it most days for more than a year and am very happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about 18 months ago to get in shape. I have used it almost every day and am very happy. I am 6'2" and it is fine for me - I think if I were any taller it wouldn't work. The action is very smooth and quiet - I often cycle while my family watch a movie or tv in the same room and I do not disturb them. I do not use the app much, but I have linked via the app to apple health and so can get data off it. not fantastically useful. Overall - very pleased with this very solid, hard-working, professional feel piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Filmmonkey

customer_reviews.title: I'm 6'6" with size 15 shoes and find this comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'6" with size 15 shoes and find this comfortable to use. Moves around easily and plenty of options for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Trnk31

customer_reviews.title: Just finished putting together
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was not difficult although was much longer because Schwinn went cheap on some of the cheapest parts. I spent about half of the assembly time trying to thread in bolts that really wanted to cross thread. That was really annoying when you're trying to hold a part in place and start a bold. I had to lubricate every one of them to get them started correctly. That was my only complaint as far as assembly was concerned. Once assembled, the instructions for use could have been more complete. Once I've spent some time using it, I'll add my comments on usability.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Pedal Broke Three Times in Two Years
customer_reviews.text: The bike seemed like a good quality machine at first but the left pedal has broken off three times now. I am not an aggressive rider, I do not stand on the pedals. It's strange that it's been only the left pedal to break. The first two times that I called Schwinn I was able to get a replacement pedal but now Schwinn's customer service is gone. You cannot get a hold of anyone by any method. I've been on hold for over an hour only to be told I have two hours to go. No response from email or their Facebook page. I've tried for weeks to reach someone. My bike is useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Defective product with no customer support
customer_reviews.text: The bike broke down after 3 months of use. I was referred to Nautilus for assistance. They only made me jump thru endless warranty hoops and refused to help.
customer_reviews.author: steven freedman

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike with lots of features.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Easy to assemble, the onboard computer and mobile apps download every ride and give me great metrics and some accountability. Great variety of modes and simple to setup custom mode. Interested to try the "VR" mode at some point, but a solid bike for those who want to keep in shape during the winter months. Bottom did fall asleep on initial rides... gonna say thats more an issue with being out of shape instead of anything wrong with the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Nerdy

customer_reviews.title: Exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: Love the bike but the seat even though it's padded was not comfortable. Got a daway cushion seat cover and it made it feel great and rideable. One thing though. Bike uses alot of electricity. So make sure it's not on a circuit that's overloaded. We fried a circuit breaker and had to move the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for a great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very great bike, and especially for the money! It has plenty of options for being a small space saving bike. You do have to have batteries or a power adapter which I choose to go for the power adapter so I don't have to worry about replenishing batteries as needed right now. My only complaint is that the wheels to move it are only on the back so pulling it forward is way harder than pushing it backward. Other than that it is a quality bike for a great price and compact!
customer_reviews.author: eadivine

customer_reviews.title: Virtually No Noise
customer_reviews.text: This bike is super quiet! I like all the resistance levels, height adjuster, the fan, console display and that it pairs with other fitness apps. My only complaints are the seat isn’t very comfortable. If you’ve ever broken your tailbone, this bike is not for you. If you have arthritis in your tailbone, it’s not for you. It also only allows for 4 user profiles. So larger families aren’t their target market. Overall, still pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andy L.

customer_reviews.title: So far I am Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I waited a week of use before I wrote this. The bike is made by Nautalis for Schwinn and Nautalis sells the exact same model. I took me a little over an hour to put together---I took my time to make sure I did it right---and it was with no difficulty. The bike runs quiet--the seat is comfortable---the display, speakers and fan are more than adequate. However, I am still figuring out some of the display features. One note---make sure that the location you are considering for the bike is close to an outlet. You'll need it for the display to work. For the price this seems to be a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Che Kerouac

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that this bike has an error and is now useless!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bike since April 2016. Today I try to use the bike, October 2017 and I have an error code e-2. I google and do all that it says to do. No luck. Really disappointed!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: tmcala

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wore out my previous bike and wanted something a little more high tech and durable. Have been using this bike for about 6 months and I'm extremely happy with it. Love the app that syncs via Bluetooth to record up to four different user's workouts. I really like the fan blowing on your face when you ride, if you turn it on. I had to place this right near a heat duct in the ceiling so when the furnace is on the cool air is a godsend. I have recommended this bike to several other people and use it an average of four days a week.
customer_reviews.author: D. Witek

customer_reviews.title: We like our covid-19 bike!
customer_reviews.text: After one week, very solid bike (170 model). Assembly was very easy, almost one hour and that was it. The positives: Great range of resistance possibilities. Quiet belt, close to silent. Looks great. Very stable bike. The not so positive things: Seat is not the most comfortable. After several days of use sitting on the bike is not much fun! The handlebars have developed a squeak when you hold them during intense use. Not terrible if you wear headphones like I do, but I can't seem to tighten anything to get it to stop.
customer_reviews.author: kraken89

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy bike for Tall people too
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift as he did want one and he does use it He is 6ft 4 weight 285 it is sturdy A good buy
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Moffatt

customer_reviews.title: not gonna break on you after a few months
customer_reviews.text: don't ever really write reviews (who has time for that?), but if you're looking for some indoor exercise in the era of COVID without spending a ton of money, look no further. for not a crazy high price you get something that won't break down when you are 230lbs and riding 150 miles per week for 4 months. the speakers are decent, the fan is a joke, and blue display is aggressively bright, but damn it I like working out on this. biggest complaint: the handlebars aren't soft and I end up using a towel to cushion my hands.
customer_reviews.author: mh

customer_reviews.title: Pull the Trigger!
customer_reviews.text: Was afraid of spending a pretty penny on an exercise bike I couldn't see in the store. This was a little heavy, but it was easy for two people to carry into the basement. My husband and I assembled this pretty easily and within an hour. We both are trying to get in shape and have put about 100 miles into this the past month. We enjoy the preset programs, the app to sync data to our phones, and the quietness. We are both happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the money
customer_reviews.text: Arrived a few days late and the shipping box was damaged, but luckily the bike itself wasn’t. Took about an hour to put together on my own. It’s very quiet, light, and easy to move around. While the bike seems pretty sturdy so far, I do feel it could be of better quality as some of the pieces feel a bit cheap. Overall very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Krg319

customer_reviews.title: It's an "OKAY" type but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: The foot straps lasted less than a week and it broke. The seat, although fastened tight, still swivel when you ride "fast". Other than that, it's ok and does what it supposed to. Now that the strap isn't there anymore, it is actually difficult to ride fast to get a decent workout since your feet will slip and slide off the pedal. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: silversea_

customer_reviews.title: Good before it’s breaks
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe after 1 year and a couple of months- the console gives out Error codes. This bike wasn’t in use much, so it’s not regular wear and tear. You’d think the company has a fix for error codes, no they want more of your money , so you have to buy a new one. I can see if it’s years and years old but seeing more reviews- I guess it’s on purpose that they do this. Schwinn was no help at all. Do not buy this bike or the phony insurance Asurion. They do not go up and beyond for customers to make things right. Scam artist.
customer_reviews.author: JESSICA JACKSON

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing almost everyday and I absolutely love it! Only downside is the fan doesn't blow at you but in a downward awkward direction and isn't adjustable. I love that I can track my progress on my phone and all the programs provides a good amount of variation in workouts
customer_reviews.author: Rubbernails

customer_reviews.title: Faulty and could not be fixed by technician after 3 week wait
customer_reviews.text: I assembled this bike on June 8, 2020. It was unusable because the console didn’t recognize the resistance and I could not adjust the resistance level. I immediately reached out to Schwinn customer service who said the motor needed replacing. A technician was not available until June 23. The technician attempted to work on installing the new motor for about an hour and ultimately advised that he could not fix it and the bike is useless. The product doesn’t work and customer service was delayed and unhelpful.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah R

customer_reviews.title: No Resistance-Motor Failure after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Bought bike in Aug 2018–two years later it no longer has any resistance levels—apparently the motor failed. This bike was used minimally to moderately by one woman of average weight, me. I was told by Schwann that I would need to purchase a motor about $50-55 and a special tool $20 and sent a set of instructions to replace the motor myself it have a tech come out at $100 plus parts to fix it. For a non tech person this repair is complicated and time consuming. My expectation is that this product would have lasted for many many years. A $400 bike not worth the money. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Kim haller

customer_reviews.title: I like this bike and hate it all at the same ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this bike and hate it all at the same time. I like that it is easy to use and helps get me back in shape, I hate that I have to use it to get back in shape... lol Great price ad well built. Easy to assemble, but 2 people make it a little easier to put together. Only took about 10 minutes to assemble. I am 6'00 and 220lbs and it seems very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy purchase
customer_reviews.text: Another bike I purchased last year and its been broken for 2 months. Repair techs giving me the run around. Unhappy with this purchase. Ive bought 2 bike by schwinn and they are both broken. I paid good money for these. And seems nobody cares about when they will be fixed
customer_reviews.author: Joseluis Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Electronics are terrible
customer_reviews.text: When working out the "Workout is paused"- states "please pedal" every 5 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Grimes

customer_reviews.title: It’s a cheap hunk of plastic.
customer_reviews.text: You really get what you pay for sometimes, and that’s the case with this bike, which is noticeably cheaply built. While assembling it, some of the plastic panels wouldn’t align or snap together as they should, so occasionally they pop off if you hit them with your leg. Using the bike itself leaves much to be desired, and I’m convinced the heart rate monitors are decorative, as they never seem to do anything. Will be returning and spending more money on a bike that will still work in a year.
customer_reviews.author: K. A.

customer_reviews.title: Incline adjusts on its own!
customer_reviews.text: Only use this bike when I can’t get to my gym so basically I don’t use this often. I jump on it today and the thing is adjusting the incline on its own. Up and down, up and down... so basically my emergency workout machine failed so now I have nothing to use. I would just spend the money to get better machine. Do your homework.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, screen too bright for me
customer_reviews.text: The bike was fairly easy to assemble, it works just fine, I only wish I could dim the screen cause it's annoyingly bright, at least for my eyes, and the lower screen seems slightly defective, nothing major but some of the digital lines don't display well (they flicker in and out). I consider that a minor issue cause I can still understand what's being displayed, and aside from that the bike works great.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: good bike!
customer_reviews.text: This bike rides smoothly and switches to different resistance levels easily. I have not yet uses any of the built in programs, just change resistance to go with my music. The only issue has been that my phone , and I have tried several does not seem to play through the speaker on the bike. I just use a Bluetooth speaker already in the gym room. This is a plug in for the bike speaker, by phone has a jack, and works elsewhere, but just wont with the bike..
customer_reviews.author: Victoria E Aurand

customer_reviews.title: Great for pregnant ladies, but handle squeaks
customer_reviews.text: I love this overall! I was very into weight lifting before I got pregnant. My husband got me this bike when I was 6 months pregnant. My only complaint is that the handles squeak. When I'm holding the handles when I hike they squeak. Doesn't seem to matter how tight I fasten them down though. Other than that it's a workout I can do while pregnant without worrying about getting hurt and I can take it as easy or hard as I want. It has a heart rate monitor built in so I can keep my eyes on that. My doctor tells all her patients to keep our heart rate under 140 when working out.
customer_reviews.author: Carissa

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try an exercise bike but wanted one with magnetic resistance and this bike is great. Went together easily on my own although I could not get the cover to snap in on the one end. VERY QUIET, you can hardly hear it in use. The seat is uncomfortable for me so I’m might change that or get a cover for it. It wasn’t until I bought this that I found out it’s the same company that also manufacture nautilus and bow flex equipment but at a very reasonable cost. Now I just have to see if I continue to use it or if it will become a coat rack like my other exercise equipment
customer_reviews.author: D215

customer_reviews.title: defective part
customer_reviews.text: the upright schwinn 170 bike never worked from the day we received it and a technician came out to replace the defective part. The replacement part was installed and the problem remained. we received another new part from mail and can't get them to come back out to install it. Instead of being something to get some exercise with It is now an expensive dust collector and cat seat . Can't really comment on how the product might work if it was usable .
customer_reviews.author: cliff

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: First exercise bike I have ever owned. I am quite impressed. It was easy to put together myself, in about 30 minutes. I am surprised with the relatively good comfort of the saddle (based on some reviews), the bike is very quiet, and the console has many features. The only thing I’m having trouble with is connecting the Bluetooth app on my phone. I also like the built in fan, speakers, and USB port for charging. I highly recommend this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P.

customer_reviews.title: Bike will break after 30 uses.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bike back in March and used roughly 30 rides. The bike worked perfectly until this week. There appears to be an issue with the sensors and the bike no longer recognizes when I’m pedaling. After a few seconds bike pauses then goes into cool down mode. We tried all the troubleshooting methods outlined on Amazon and the website, no success. I’ve reached out to the manufacturer and have not received a response. After reading other reviews this appears to be a common occurrence with this bike and is very unfortunate. Only after a few months a $500 bike is broken. Would not recommend this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Big
customer_reviews.text: This was relatively easy to assemble, although it definitely requires two people for some parts. The biggest issue for me is that it’s too big for someone who’s 5’5” tall. A regular bicycle is 12” center pedal to central pedal; this cycle is 15”. This difference has caused knee pain and other issues. In addition, I am unable to read all the information on the top part of the display - the ledge for a tablet interferes with my line of vision. I’ve had the Schwinn 170 for a week, and am seriously considering returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: nethermind my regions
customer_reviews.text: I reached out to support as requested but couldn't reach anyone, so I'm now leaving my review here. It arrived damaged (cowling was cracked). Assembly took about 45 mins and bike seems sturdy (I'm a large man). The bike is smooth and quiet. The major issue with this bike is that the seat does tend to cut off circulation to your nether regions. I'm looking to see if I can find a different saddle for it though. ---EDIT--- I was able to use a regular bike saddle - I had help to put it all together but now I ride safely.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Moore

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay, But...
customer_reviews.text: It's quiet and sturdy, but that's about it. The pedal RPMs change WAY too quickly - several times per second. The history reads the same for 7 and 30 days. The power cord is too short. Support from Nautilus is difficult. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this bike!
customer_reviews.text: The bike is sturdy, comfortable to ride, and worth the limited floor space I have. I am very impressed. I may never go back to the gym. I set this up in front of the TV and do 10 minute intervals with a set of free weights before, anlfter, and in between. There is almost zero noise from the machine other than some beeps now and then. I appreciate the little fan on the display. I'm sweaty and so happy!
customer_reviews.author: NorCalSteph

customer_reviews.title: Seat loosens up and turns with use.
customer_reviews.text: I love my bike. It was so eash to put together (i was able to do it alone). The only problem I have with it is that the seat sucks. It is very very hard and it does not screw on tight. Pedal for five minutes and the seat turns. Not sure if there is a way to get a better seat on it. Overall an amazing bike for a first time owner.
customer_reviews.author: Martine

customer_reviews.title: Great features for non spinners
customer_reviews.text: My ex was a spinning instructor so we always had a spinning bike around the house. A little boring if you're not in a class. For the same or less money, this unit has programmed workouts so you don't have to constantly change the wheel resistance and lets you pair it to VR workout apps so it seems as if you are cycling through the redwoods or along the ocean. It even tracks and saves your progress for motivation. If you are not a dedicated spinning enthusiast but want a good aerobic workout, this is the bike for you at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: mcfo

customer_reviews.title: the seat is not comfortable, not easy to install
customer_reviews.text: It does what it should do, the seat is not comfortable, not easy to install. The quality is not same as older Shwinn model which I used without issues for 5 yrs.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise bike and awesome return service by Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike. I've had it a month and ride it almost every day. Quiet, compact, and easy to move around. The speakers are not very loud playing media off my phone but that's not a worry for me. The different programs are good and the levels are between easy and getting a good sweat up. The first bike we received started making a clunking noise through the pedals the fist day I ride it. I called Amazon and boxed it up receiving my next bike in two days. They picked up the defective one too. No problems. Awesome service Amazon. So a month on I'm still loving my bike and absolutely no problems with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Solid investment
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the directions (lol) it goes together very well and is quiet when operating. Moving it around is doable but not easy only because of the weight which is a good thing and the fact that mine is on carpeting with a mat. There are more apps out there and tethering to my tablet was not a problem. Now I just hope it will not be used for a clothing rack. Stay Well
customer_reviews.author: Uncle J

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed, comfortable and works well
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't provide actual heart rate, even when synced with a Bluetooth monitor, other than a fitness range. This is not adequate for anyone who is medically required to limit their maximum heart rate. Also, the Schwinn Trainer program doesn't monitor your performance in real time, but just records the session, when you finish.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice machine, it’s quiet and gives me a good workout. A necessity when living in a cold climate, it gives you a way to get some excersize. It has a small footprint and it takes up very little space. I keep it in my living room where I can ride while watching tv. The seat requires additional tools to install it correctly, the little wrench it comes with is inadequate for properly tightening it. Other than that I put it together in less than an hour by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT ORDER ONLINE. MISSING PARTS
customer_reviews.text: Honestly not the worst bike I’ve ever owed but dear was this box and everything inside all messed up and scratched. Look like a bomb went off inside and really didn’t think it would go together. But with lots of struggle and plenty of missing bolts/screws I finally put it together. Just to realize the seat never actually tightens and the front looks like a cat clawed at it from the trip over. Do not recommend anyone orders online. Maybe in store purchase or different shipping company. 1 star because it actually got to my front door lol
customer_reviews.author: Ylime706

customer_reviews.title: The bike is great. Super quiet
customer_reviews.text: The seat is the only thing that held me back from 5 stars. The bike is great. Super quiet, can watch TV across the room and still hear it perfectly. THAT QUIET!!! The motion is good. I'm sure for the crazy prices of some other bikes it could be better, but I'm happy. The seat....awful. 15 minutes and you are done. In that 15 minutes I tried everything possible. Nothing. So ordered the Schwinn quilted seat. ($24.00) and so much better. Not perfect, but did 40 minutes on bike and wasn't cursing! So when ordering the bike, go ahead, spend the extra $24.00...you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective Bike
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this bike would have been perfect if it worked. The resistance does not increase on the bike. When we called customer support, it was confirmed that this is a reoccurring issue. Another bike is on its way but will not be here for another month or so. Very disappointing. I'm interested to see if this bike will be defective as well.
customer_reviews.author: Meg L

customer_reviews.title: Well built, small footprint, easy to assemble, quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Bike came in a single, large box that easily fit through doors on a dolly. Contents of the box were well secured with tape, styrofoam and padding. The directions were very easy to follow. The tool provided will get the job done but for the seat, it’s better to have one tool to tighten while the other side is held by another tool. Set up of each user on the system was easy but syncing the app to the machine was even easier. The ride is incredibly quiet thanks to a well built, sturdy machine.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike April 16 around $500 :May 8 $974???????
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Electronics suck
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace same model from 5 years ago. I was very pleased with that bike, expected the same with this one. Like the first one, assembly was not difficult. Resistance is substantially harder than last bike but I figured it might loosen up over time. The major issue is with the electronics of it. The 7 day totals and 30 day totals are not accurate. May seem like not a big deal to most considering everything else is fine, but it matters to OCD guys like me.
customer_reviews.author: Seeking Quality

customer_reviews.title: It broke the first week, it is just sitting ...
customer_reviews.text: It broke the first week, it is just sitting there until I can throw it out, it is hard for me since I am a disabled veteran I have to pay someone to throw it out for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Can connect via Bluetooth, but not for Media. :(
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about the product except for the bluetooth functionality. I can connect via bluetooth only to update the tracker app, yet I cannot connect via bluetooth to play music. To play music the Phone or device can only be connected via 3mm Jack. It seems like a wasted opportunity to have bluetooth but not be able to connect for Media playback.
customer_reviews.author: Jullian Jer Esconde

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I got this last July and have been using it six days a week, since. I don't use most of the features, I just slap a pair of earbuds in, crank up the resistance to 9 or 10 and sweat it out for thirty minutes each day. It's stable, it's quiet, (although the bike seat tends to loosen on occasion), I am six foot, three, and it's big enough for my gangly self. This is a darn good product.
customer_reviews.author: F. E. Feeley Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: Update to an earlier review. Five stars only because it is everything I want in my ergometer. The cable to the pedals from the control panel had come loose and caused it to suddenly stop sensing my pedaling but after reconnecting, all is good. I like this because I can make a custom program or use the pre sets, of which there are many. None of the stuff like on the Peloton and that's what i wanted.
customer_reviews.author: R Z Bannon

customer_reviews.title: terrible product and terrible service !!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst bike I have ever owned. It broke a few months after buying it - called Customer Care at Nautilus, I - they are terrible! They ask you to take the bike apart yourself and if you cannot correct the problem yourself it will cost you $130 just for a guy to come out and check it out !!! WHAT A JOKE !!! DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: No Quality Check Done by Amazon and Schwinn
customer_reviews.text: I was completely disappointed that I received a shipment that had no quality control performed on it. The front and rear stabilizers did not fit the Bike. I followed the instructions manual to a T which stated that the wheels on a stabilizer belong to the front of the bike therefore the stabilizers were ill-fitting. And could not stabilize the bike. I ordered a replacement only to receive the same error and worse. The replacement bike was somebody's used return with a damaged bike seat and the same problem of wrong size stabilizers. Very disappointed with both Amazon and Schwinn.
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Love the compact size
customer_reviews.text: I didnt want a large stationary bike taking up a lot of room. I was not disappointed by this bike and how little room it takes up. I just wanted a simple bike to use in the winter months when I cant ride my regular bike. Great features for the $. Nice deal.
customer_reviews.author: TRIBALCHIEF

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy construction, very quiet, lots of programs, and the heart rate monitor works well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike on Dec 27, 2018 at Amazon, for $449.00 US dollars. So far it has been great for me. I am a big guy, 5ft. 10 in, 295 lbs. Assembly was very easy, it took about 90 minutes by myself. The only problem is the seat is very uncomfortable to me, probably because of my weight. I ordered a new extra wide and padded seat to try instead. I give it 4/5 stars now because of the seat, but if the new seat makes it more comfortable, I will update my review and give it a 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McNairy

customer_reviews.title: SUPER UNCOMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: I had a Scwinn excercise bike for over 15 years and it finally bit the dust. I rode it most every day. I ordered this one to replace it and I don’t like it. The seat is very hard and uncomfortable. Also you can raise the seat up and down but you can’t change the angle. I feel like I’m going to fall forward when I’m on it. I purchased a recommended seat cover and that doesn’t help. I used to look forward to riding my bike and now I don’t want to get on it. I’m hoping I can push through and it doesn’t become a clothes rack.
customer_reviews.author: deedee

customer_reviews.title: There were damaged and missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: I had difficulty assembling the unit. One of the electrical wiring assemblies had two of the four wires cut – apparently with a wire cutter. I contacted Schwinn to advise them of the difficulty. They never responded to several inquiries. I gave up and soldered the cut wires and finished the installation. Then I found that there is no power cord. I went to the Amazon website to see if they could help – to no use. The only reason I gave it one star is there was no way to give it zero stars. Amazon’s product support on this item was poor – Schwinn’s was worse.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Newman

customer_reviews.title: Damaged package arrived
customer_reviews.text: pretty unacceptable to spend over $1000 and get a package that’s obviously been opened and taped up and has damage . Not even going to bother to unpack it and look at it obviously it’s defective
customer_reviews.author: NancyGee

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: This bike works well. We've had it for about 6 months with no issues. It's not overly noisy, and has a relatively small footprint. I'm a mountain biker, and my only complaint is I wish it had some higher resistance levels, as it only goes to level 8. I can get a good workout in, but I put it on manual and keep it between level 6-8. Anything less and it's almost like not pedaling at all. That being said, the rest of my family gets a decent workout with the preset workouts. Overall, a decent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: It's nice to have but has a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: Assembly seemed easy. However, they have pre inserted screws on the back of the display. One of the four was completely stripped and despite all my efforts I couldn't remove it.l and it's currently mounted with one screw still in on the back of the display. It's roughly an hour of hold time to talk to anyone about it. Also the left side peddal makes a slight "clunck clunck" at every rotation. Other than that, not bad. Would prefer to have no issues, but for home equipment, it's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Dana P

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy! Has exceeded our expectations
customer_reviews.text: What a steal for the price. Sturdy! Has exceeded our expectations. My husband and I have been using daily since Nov and it seems like it will hold up for a long time. We had to have it redelivered like 3x before we got one that was not damaged during the shipping process but it was worth the wait
customer_reviews.author: currenakat

customer_reviews.title: One Great Bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is one great bike. Our local YMCA is closing and we decided to use a spare bedroom for a gym by getting a Schwinn 170 and a treadmill. I'm used to riding a Matrix bike in the gym but this Schwinn 170 actually has a smoother ride. It is one great bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald C Dudelston

customer_reviews.title: Provides good in-home service.
customer_reviews.text: I use it 6 days a week for 1-4 hours a day. My doctor suggested a stationary bicycle instead of recumbent bike because I have torn meniscus in both knees. Easy to get on and just start peddling. Very quiet. I can watch television at the same time without having to turn up the volume, or just relax and meditate in my zone.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Page

customer_reviews.title: Love this bike, health club quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazingly solid bike, lots of features including a USB charger. The small fan is not the strongest, but does make a difference. The bike is well built and runs almost silently. A real steal at this price.
customer_reviews.author: QASE

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together-30 minutes for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together-30 minutes for 2 people. Easy to use. Very quiet. And fits in a small space. The only drawback is that it does not have an operating manual. I like to read how to operate before I use. But with a few attempts I have figured out some of the programs. Just not sure I am using all the features.
customer_reviews.author: nancy l

customer_reviews.title: Nice Home-use Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is the exercise bike to get. We had one for years that served its purpose, but it was time for an upgrade. The features of this bike are great, and it gives an excellent workout. My wife uses it daily, where-as I am only an occasional user. It has multiple profiles for each person, so everyone can keep track of their progress. Overall, it does everything we want and more.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: NOT A GOOD SCHWINN EXPERIENCE SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: Second attempt to buy a Schwinn product. First one monitor did not work. Upgraded to a “better” model at @$200 more. After assembly, monitor works but NO Resistance Control working. Connections rechecked & are good. Customer service representative thought motor needed replaced but, could not guarantee a fix. Seemed she could care less about finding a solution. Returning. Again.
customer_reviews.author: George R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my Schwinn bike for a few month now. It is quiet and relatively easy to move which is important to me ( I am in my 50's). I decided to switch to a bike as opposed to a treadmill to lower the impact on my back and knees. I have tried the Ride social once or twice. It's a nice break for something different. The seat height is fairly easy to adjust. I would prefer the seat to be a little more comfortable but it is a pretty comfortable seat as far as bike seats go. Overall I'm very happy with the bike!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Does what I need, quietly and smoothly. Have not gotten Bluetooth to work but that may be my error. Anyway not up to the disassemble and reassemble to reinstall and then 50/50 if it works. I know it is plugged in so not sure anything I might do will fix that. Not a big deal as I don't intend to do the gym rat spin torture.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike is perfect for my husband and I. Easy to adjust land the seat is larger than a spin bike. The only issue we found is the WiFi ability. Can’t get the Schwinn ap.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Really nice exercise bike. Only minor quibbles with the bike's design. The seat is not very comfortable for even 30 minute workouts. However, I have yet to find an exercise bike anywhere that the seat was comfortable so this is minor and expected just get a different seat or a gel bike seat cover. The only other issue was minor inaccuracy in the manual where its says you can use the up and down arrows to pick a user which is not true you must use the user button. I would highly recommend the bike.
customer_reviews.author: tgreenwa

customer_reviews.title: Ease to assemble not so easy on the ass!
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to put together, if you do have issues look up a tutorial on YouTube. Very quite and easy to use. The seat is horrible though, super uncomfortable, at least it was to me! I ordered a new one and it’s a lot better and way more comfortable. Very ease to move around if need be. Wish the power cord was located in the back and was longer.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: i love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Gym quality; sturdy and challenging. No complaints. I ordered this after my daughter just bought one. She loves it too!
customer_reviews.author: frugal designer

customer_reviews.title: A10 bike is solid and a super value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how solid the exercise bike was after assembly. The instructions were spot on. Make sure all the nuts and screws are evenly tightened firmly and you will have a great workout tool. The exercise programs are automatic. One bummer is the display is not backlit, but any ambient light shining on it will make the screen easily readable. I would recommend this bike to anyone who wants a home exercise bike. Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Peter deCardi

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth connectivity issue
customer_reviews.text: Just received package. Assembly was easy and the construction feels solid. Test ride is smooth and quiet. My only issue is with the Bluetooth connectivity. The bike will only connect through the schwinn app, so if you want to listen to music through the built in speakers you have to connect your phone via a 3.5mm headphone jack. Luckily my phone still has a headphone jack; people with new phones will definitely run into problems. It's one of those little annoyances that separates a good experience with a great one.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Summer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and silent
customer_reviews.text: I think bike is silent and I can work out while family members are sleeping. 170 model comes with power adaptor. I bought it before ordering bike, but bike comes with everything. I did purchased a mat to avoid scratches on floor. Assembly - Yet to use the bike but assembly was easy. May need 2 people to put the handle part together.
customer_reviews.author: Pallavi Joshi

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because Schwinn reportedly has a good reputation. But I was disappointed within a month of using. The wheels are squeaking and catching. And the seat was very unsteady as well. The resistance is variable and unpredictable. I will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Chananya Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a good bike for me since I am just a casual rider that needs something to help we workup a sweat to improve my cardio. It's built good enough though not a fitness club level quality. The controls are easy to use and easily readable. I would highly recommend this bike for the causal fitness buff.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the stationary bike for two months and the resistance levels stopped working. The wheel just spins freely. As I write this review I’m on hold with the seller, I’ve been told my wait time is 86 minutes, I’ve also been told that this is the quickest way to speak with anyone. Pretty frustrated at the moment. I did like the product when it was working.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Sava

customer_reviews.title: Beware of defective wiring
customer_reviews.text: The wiring for the bike was defective and so I could not adjust the resistance level, making it impossible to move the pedals. The bike seat did not fit securely so kept slipping The main console mount was not secure and kept twisting There was a 3 hour wait on customer service phone line We returned the bike and will seek another product
customer_reviews.author: PTA

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Do not order this bike. Only one use before it was unusable. Still waiting for customer support to respond.
customer_reviews.author: Old-Sun

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: For the price, the bike is at a semi professional level. It actually does not provide a lot of fancy functions but it is well made, comfortable, sturdy and stable, no feeling of toy like cheaper ones. But it's not expensive at all. I ride it 3 times a week and it helps me a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, great for convenient exercise option
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a family member. I have an earlier Schwinn upright and this new version is also very easy to assemble, sturdy, quiet, great ergonomics, all at a great price. Uprights take up less floor space . . .we keep it in the living room and can ride it watching TV with a fan on to get a breeze. Excellent for those rainy or snowy days when going outside is not an option. Would happily buy again if needed, but these are durable (had mine >10 years).
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Carbon

product_meta.title: Schwinn Upright Bike Series
product_meta.description: The Schwinn Fitness Active Series offers our most streamlined design yet. Designed for a fluid, comfortable ride, it moves you quickly towards your goals with our workout programs. Intuitive and ergonomic, it’s loaded with user-friendly features for a cardio workout that’s effective, comfortable and enjoyable.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes One Schwinn Upright Series Bike – 170 model

Exercise bike dimensions: 41.3” L x 21.4” W x 55.6” H. | Product weight: 58.4 pounds | Weight capacity: 300 pounds | User height range: 4’6” to 6’6” | Flywheel weight: 10 pounds | Plugs to any standard electrical outlet on an 110V-120V circuit.
A high resolution, backlit DualTrack LCD screen with 29 exercise programs so you can track your progress and an adjustable 3-speed fan to keep you cool

Easily adjust the contoured seat with forearms rests and includes ergonomic handlebars feature integrated heart rate grip sensors. Includes an oversized water bottle holder, 3 piece cranks, and transport wheels

Keep track of time, distance, and calorie goals on the machine and with Schwinn Connect or MyFitnessPal with the USB input and the MP3 input allowing for music through the built-in speakers with a USB charging port for your electronic devices

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
